qas.question: The analysis of stratigraphic sections such as drill cores is done by who?
What type of surveys show the location of stratigraphic units in the subsurface?
What can be combined with geophysical data to produce a better view of the subsurface?
What tool do stratigraphers use to see their data in three dimensions?
Stratigraphers try to locate areas for what types of extraction?
What do computers analyze in the lab?
What is an example of what is analyzed by computers in the lab?
What do drill cores show about water location?

plausible_answers.text: a better view of the subsurface

qas.question: What can drill cores and ancient processes be combined to show?

plausible_answers.text: ancient processes occurring on the surface of the Earth

qas.question: What do computers use coal to reconstruct?
What are taken from the laboratory into the field?
What shows the location of drill cores?
What computer program allows stratigraphers to view the subsurface in three dimensions?

plausible_answers.text: the locations of stratigraphic units in the subsurface
interpret past environments, and locate areas for water, coal, and hydrocarbon extraction

qas.question: What are ancient processes used to do?
